title: Increases compensation in N.Y. city for election inspectors from $130 to $250 and election coordinators from $200 to $350
summary: Increases compensation in New York city for election inspectors from $130 to $250 and election coordinators from $200 to $350.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1004

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. PHEFFER, MAYERSOHN, COOK, DINOWITZ, COLTON, GOTT-
         FRIED, KAVANAGH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CYMBROWITZ, HEASTIE,
         JACOBS,  MILLMAN,  PERRY, WEISENBERG, WRIGHT -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Election Law

       AN ACT to amend  the  election  law,  in  relation  to  compensation  of
         election officials

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 3-420  of  the  election  law,  as
    2  amended  by  chapter  180  of  the  laws  of 2005, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    1. Election inspectors, poll clerks, election coordinators and  quali-
    5  fied  voters  appointed to act in place of an absent inspector, clerk or
    6  coordinator shall be paid for their services on the days of registration
    7  and election, by the county containing the election  district  in  which
    8  they  serve,  in an amount fixed by the county legislative body, subject
    9  to such limitations as shall be prescribed  or  authorized  by  statute,
   10  except  that  in  the  city  of New York the amount of such compensation
   11  shall be payable by such city and shall be fixed by the mayor at a daily
   12  rate which, in the case of election inspectors shall not  be  less  than
   13  [one  hundred  thirty]  TWO  HUNDRED  FIFTY  dollars  and in the case of
   14  election coordinators not less than [two hundred]  THREE  HUNDRED  FIFTY
   15  dollars.  Such inspectors, poll clerks, election coordinators and quali-
   16  fied voters at a general or special village election  conducted  by  the
   17  board  of  elections shall be paid by such village in an amount fixed by
   18  the village board of trustees subject to any such limitations.
   19    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00524-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to compensation of election officials
